ratings.comment: I really enjoyed Natalia's lectures, she was quite knowledgeable about the content and so she was excellent to learn from. Reading was pretty light, and assignments were also usually not very intensive — some short essays might have asked for about just 300 words or so. I wish there was more work but I still got a lot from the lectures.

Can't really understand why her ratings aren't higher - took her for Soc 211 and it was so easy. No in person exams, 1 small assignment a week that would never take me more than 30 mins. Shes sweet and would let me leave class early when I had chem exams after. Sometimes the long lectures were boring but if ur interested in soc they're not bad.

Took her for sociology 211. It seems as if during lecture all you need to do is copy down what is on the slide, but you need to be writing down what she is saying. There are weekly quizzes or essay (rarely essays). Midterm tests, essays, final test, and final essay are all worth 70% of your grade.

I took Asian Am 220 w/ Natalia and ended up never going to lecture. She was awesome and the topics were interesting, but I was constantly writing papers for the class. There are two exams which are very random questions. If you love writing about sociology, I'd recommend for Comm B, TAs are awesome too, but there are easier Comm B courses.

This professor is extremely unhelpful and does not know what's going on in terms of assignments or essays. If you ask her a question about these, she will refuse to give you an answer. She rambles a lot, and lectures are boring. She also says "um" a lot... so if that's something that bothers you, heads up. Hope this review helped!!
